statement: “After California taxes, Trey Lance's $34.1M rookie deal becomes just $16M."

author: Noah Y.
statement: “Montana is canceling unemployment because of a workforce shortage.”

author: Madeline Heim
statement: "There’s no strings attached to that money that we’d be getting as an incentive to expand Medicaid."

author: Madison Czopek
statement: 11.6 million people watched Biden’s first presidential address to Congress while far larger audiences watched Donald Trump’s speeches.

author: Louis Jacobson
statement: “Corporate income has increased as a share of” gross domestic product.

author: Lyle Muller
statement: "Only <6% of the $2.1 trillion 'infrastructure' bill contains funding for roads & bridges.”

author: Haley BeMiller
statement: A new state agreement with Foxconn “will save Wisconsin taxpayers $2.77 billion.”

author: Paul Specht
statement: “One of (Joe Biden’s) first acts in office was sending an immigration bill to Congress to grant mass amnesty to illegal immigrants.”

author: Amy Sherman
statement: Says his administration’s efforts have led to more school reopenings.

author: Tom Kertscher
statement: Children ages 5 to 9 “are not affected by” the coronavirus.

author: Kiannah Sepeda-Miller
statement: “We have 23% of all the lead pipe leads in America in the Chicagoland area.”

author: Tom Kertscher
statement: "Kids in cages" in border facilities are "at 700% capacity."

author: Jill Terreri
statement: "In fact, the data coming in from some states that have legalized marijuana is that they actually see a decrease in use over time, particularly among young people."

author: Tom Kertscher
statement: “Kids at the border: 2,600 highest number Trump, 12,000 currently under Biden.”

author: Tom Kertscher
statement: Colorado “requires photo ID to vote in person, requires signature verification for mail-in ballots, which Georgia got rid of, and prevents campaign workers from giving food, water to voters within 100 feet if they’re wearing campaign apparel.”

author: Haley BeMiller
statement: "Over the past decade, drug prices have risen at three times the rate of inflation."

author: Louis Jacobson
statement: The proposal by President Joe Biden would put the U.S. “No. 2 in the world” for the highest corporate tax rate.

author: Raeanne Beckner
statement: H.R. 1 “mandates practices nationwide” that include “ballot harvesting, universal mail-in voting and same-day registration.”

author: Warren Fiske
statement: “Two out of our last three governors in Virginia were investigated by the FBI. One went to jail and one is running for office again in this election.”

author: Eric Litke
statement: “It took the Legislature nearly 300 days to act on a (COVID-19) bill during this pandemic.”

author: Jon Greenberg
statement: Says Deborah Birx “traveled a great distance to see her family for Thanksgiving, only to have them call the police and turn her in. She then ... resigned.”

author: Tom Kertscher
statement: “Minority farmers get big bonus, white ones get none,” because of Democrats.

author: Eric Litke
statement: Judge Jeff Davis "spent years defending a convicted cop killer" and "tried to get him off the hook."

author: Noah Y.
statement: Nike and Lil Nas X are launching “demonic shoes” containing human blood.

author: Brandon Mulder
statement: "We began seeing the increase in unaccompanied minors going back to last April 2020. This is not something that happened as a result of Joe Biden becoming president.”

author: Jon Greenberg
statement: The Democratic clean energy plan is pro-China, because "90% of the solar panels, 80% of the wind machines, 90% of the rare earth minerals … are in Asia or in China.”

author: Julie Appleby
statement: “Sorry Dr Fauci and other fearmongers, new study shows vaccines and naturally acquired immunity DO effectively neutralize COVID variants.”

author: Bill McCarthy
statement: "In 2004, George W. Bush lifted the ban on those (AR-15 type) rifles, and since then, the number of massacres has increased 183%. During the ban, there were 12 incidents. Since he lifted the ban, there were 34 incidents."

author: Paul Specht
statement: "Illegal border crossings are up 173% from 1 year ago and 28% since January when President Biden stopped the wall & deportations and started catch & release."

author: Miriam Valverde
statement: The border surge is “challenging” because the immigration system that had been in place for decades “was dismantled in its entirety by the Trump administration.”

author: Ciara O'Rourke
statement: “Last week, the Colorado Supreme Court declared that Boulder’s AR-15 ban was unconstitutional. Today, there was a mass shooting in Boulder.”

author: Kiannah Sepeda-Miller
statement: The American Rescue Plan Act “does not” include “checks and balances” on how funds for state and local governments can be spent.

author: Laura Schulte
statement: “We have reached our goal to clear the backlog of (unemployment) claims.”

author: D.L. Davis
statement: "Wisconsin is one of only nine states in the nation in which 17 year-olds are automatically treated as adults in the criminal justice system."

author: Louis Jacobson
statement: The Republican tax bill passed in 2017 "gave 83% of the benefits to the top 1%."

author: Miriam Valverde
statement: Says the Biden administration is canceling immigration detainers and “requiring our law enforcement leaders to release” serious criminal offenders.

author: Chris Nichols
statement: “California’s [COVID-19] death rate has remained one of the lowest per capita in the nation: 134 deaths per 100,000, compared to 158 nationally, 153 in Texas and 247 in New York.”

author: William Skipworth
statement: Says his amendment on a budget bill “would have helped get kids back in school after teachers were vaccinated. Every single Senate Democrat voted against it.”

author: Jon Greenberg
statement: In rejecting his amendment, “Democrats voted to send reopening money to schools that refuse to reopen.”

author: Jill Terreri
statement: Says Gov. Andrew Cuomo "issued a legal blanket immunity, and snuck that into our budget, giving these facilities essentially a license to kill, a get-out-of-jail free card.”

author: Madeline Heim
statement: "Youth usage of marijuana has actually gone down in states that have fully legalized.”

author: Chris Nichols
statement: Voting-rights legislation proposed by Democrats in Congress called H.R. 1 “would force states to restore the voting rights of convicted felons—including violent felons convicted of murder or rape.”

author: Amy Sherman
statement: Says the American Civil Liberties Union opposes H.R. 1 on grounds that “it threatens our freedom of speech.”

author: Jon Greenberg
statement: “There’s about 9% of (the American Rescue Plan) actually going to COVID, meaning 91% of it is not even COVID-related.”

author: Louis Jacobson
statement: “I have never sued a nun — any nuns.”

author: Kiannah Sepeda-Miller
statement: “For the month of February, Illinois has been the vaccination leader among the 10 most populous states in the country.”

author: Eric Litke
statement: “On average, 17% of a family’s income goes towards child care in Wisconsin.”
